p.s: The reunion with Daisy is what Gatsby has been working on desperatlydesperately for the last five years, so when it finally happens he is extremlyextremely overwhelmed and very enthusiastic as well.
But looking at it from a more objective perspective, reviving a past relationship, especially in Gatsby's case is a very complicated issue.
On the positive side, it is obvious, that after the rough start Daisy and Gatsby seem to get along really well, especially with Nick leaving them on the sofa, while they are holding hands.
While this creates a rather positive outlook for a possible reviving of their relationship, there are some difficulties which need to be considered.
The very obvious one: Daisy is a married woman.
She is married to Tom Buchanan and Gatsby knows that.

Even though Tom has an affair as well, that doesn't automatically mean that he wouldn't care if Daisy had one looking at his agressiveaggressive and dominant character you can assume, that he would not approve of it and would probably be extremlyextremely angry.
Daisy knows how hurt she was and still his by Tom's many affairs, so it could be difficult for her to do the same.
It is crucial to consider as well, that Gatsby has an almost unhealthy obsession with Daisy, collecting newspaper articles of her.
Nick describes this as well; Gatsby is in love with the idea of Daisy.
An idea which he's built up for five years, so that she simply just can't live up to his idea of her, as it is completely exaggerated.
Daisy is not the same person anymore and things might have changed, which could destroy GatsbysGatsby's image of her, that he's been holding onto for so long.
In general you could say, why not just try it.
At least there wouldn't be anything to reget and this probably applies for many relationships.
But sometimes it is also important to just let go of something eventually and not force it.
It might not be that healthy for your mind to go back into the past all the time and try to change because of what happened in the past.
There is always a reason for why the relationship hasn't worked out in the past and it is quite probable that these same reasons could cause trouble in the present as well.
In my opinion it would be better for Gatsby to let go of Daisy, as she probably can't live up to his imagination anyways and reinforces his materialism.
But realistically there's a good chance of them getting back together, with Gatsby being madly in love and Daisy just not being the most loyal wife, as she has no reason to be.
